column2: 1. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.

column2: 2. Drivers who are 21 years of age or older considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
3. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 4. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column8: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.

column4: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column6: mean that road conditions will improve soon.
column8: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column10: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.

column4: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM

column2: 9. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: stop doing what they are doing.
column10: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 10. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

column2: 21. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.

column2: 22. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column8: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column10: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
